column5: l m a o Great song,can any other relate? LOL  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3KI6g01zO-A
Ah, a good ol Bell Island bye. Thats were me mudders from.
Please watch this one, more Great Big Sea.  I love the idea of a Ceilidh, and usuallly end up trying to play over the talkers. Now I know that the answer is to have everyone play someting or odder.
Ceilidh  is a tradition as old as time itself. Also known as a kitchen party these days. Me I'm a big fan of the "Shanty Man"

Love this type of music. Grew up listening to it. Took my wife(Mainlander   ) home 2 years ago for her first mummering experience where you get to see this type of music for real. I grew up playing the fiddle, squeezebox spoons and the tinwhistle. Should of seen my wifes face.  Great now I'm homesick.
I got a good dose of it as a kid. I'd spend a month at a time with my uncle in N.S. up Jeddore way. That and watching Don Messers and his fiddle music every week on the CBC.
That is a great tune Misfish.....usually ends up cranked as loud as she'll go somewhere between midnight, the last beer, and bed. LOL Ya I can relate.
